sources.title: Murder at the Baskervilles
sources.description: Title: Murder at the Baskervilles Summary: Sherlock Holmes takes a vacation and visits his old friend Sir Henry Baskerville. His vacation ends when he suddenly finds himself in the middle of a double-murder mystery. Now he's got to ... Directed by: Thomas Bentley Actors: Arthur Wontner, Ian Fleming, Lyn Harding Production Company: Julius Hagen Productions Release Date: 15 January 1941 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Sherlock Holmes takes a vacation and visits his old friend Sir Henry Baskerville. His vacation ends when he suddenly finds himself in the middle of a double-murder mystery. Now he's got to find Professor Moriarty and the horse Silver Blaze before the great cup final horse race.

sources.title: Murder At The Baskervilles
sources.description: From IMDb : Sherlock Holmes takes a vacation and visits his old friend Sir Henry Baskerville. His vacation ends when he suddenly finds himself in the middle of a double-murder mystery. Now he's got to find Professor Moriarty and the horse Silver Blaze before the great cup final horse race.

sources.title: Murder At The Baskervilles ( 1937) Sherlock Holmes Crime & Mystery
sources.description: Returning to Baskerville Hall, brilliant detective Sherlock Holmes (Arthur Wontner) envisions a relaxing holiday with his dear friend Sir Henry Baskerville (Lawrence Grossmith). Soon, however, Holmes and his intrepid assistant, Dr. Watson (Ian Fleming), become ensnared in a plot to fix a prestigious Â race in which Baskerville's horse, Silver Blaze, is the favorite. When two people are found dead as a result of the gambling plot, suspicion falls on Holmes' bitter rival, Moriarty (Lyn Harding).

metadata.Plot: Sherlock Holmes takes a vacation and visits his old friend Sir Henry Baskerville. His vacation ends when he suddenly finds himself in the middle of a double-murder mystery. Now he's got to find Professor Moriarty and the horse Silver Blaze before the great cup final horse race.
metadata.Writer: Arthur Conan Doyle, Arthur Macrae, H. Fowler Mear
metadata.Actors: Arthur Wontner, Ian Fleming, Lyn Harding
